ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks - yes I am finding that myself now as I work through the lesson. I'll try to have something more current up this week.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Clusters
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Michael, The cluster jump should be set to "Unseen questions within a cluster", this is the default when you create a cluster page and you should not change it or the cluster will not work. It is true that cluster only work for questions page not for content pages and to my best knowledge it has always been like that even in Moodle 1.9. Even more if you put  a content page between the cluster ad end of cluster pages it will alter the cluster working, this is because content page mark the beginning of a subcluster (see https://docs.moodle.org/28/en/Lesson_clusters#Sub-Clusters ) so you should not do that if you don't want to use subclusters. As I said to Mary the intended purpose of a cluster is to present a group of question pages in a random order to all students. No more no less And I can add that the subcluster intended purpose is to present only one question page in a group of question pages to the student So for instance if you have Q1, C1 , Q2, Q3, B1 , Q4, Q5, Q6, EB1 , Q7, EC1 , Q8 (this example is extracted from the documentation) where C means cluster, B means content page (that were named branch tables in Moodle 1.9), EB means end of branch and EC means end of cluster all student will see Q1 as first question and Q8 as last question all students will see Q2, Q3 and Q7 but we don't know in which order each student will see only one question picked at random among Q4, Q5 and Q6 and we don't know at what moment it will be shown to them between Q1 and Q8 All students will see exactly 6 questions neither C1, B1, EB1 and EC1 will be displayed to student (Yes the content page B1 will not be displayed !) Last thing, unfortunately in Moodle 2.8.4+, your problem when editing a cluster page that the jump is changed to "Next page" and the cluster is broken is still not fixed (it is already fixed in the future Moodle 2.9) but hopefully it will be fixed this week or next one because the fix is currently in integration (you can look at MDL-48897 to follow the integration process and know when it is closed). Note to all Moodle users: if you are interested in using clusters and subclusters in your lessons it is mandatory that you upgrade your Moodle to a very very recent release because I found numerous bugs while working on them.

ResponsesInList.Title: Lesson Question Corrections
ResponsesInList.Text: One of the things I would really like to see (if it isn't available somewhere already) is a recording of all a student's answers to lesson questions.  Currently, all I see is one response per student attempt.  If they get and answer wrong never get the correct answer, I cannot see all their attempted answers.  If they eventually get it correct, I don't see their failed attempt.  (Sadly, the lesson module doesn't give points to for question if it the student didn't get the answer correct the first time.) Here's the situation I have run into: A student came to me and said that he had entered the correct answer, but Moodle didn't accept it.  Since the first time he attempted the question, he gave a wrong answer, that is the only answer I could see.  I couldn't see his other answers to be able to evaluate what he was doing wrong and, therefore, I couldn't explain to him why Moodle said it was wrong, while he was adamant that he had answered it correctly.  In the quiz module, I can see every attempted answer.  Lesson only the first one or the correct one - none in between.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: how to restrict  unauthendicate user
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Prasanna, I think I understand many of the things you are saying. I am not sure what "my resource" means. Authentication refers to the process which allows a user to enter a Moodle site. The key word you are looking for is Enrolment in a course. Like Authentication, there is a lot to say. I suggest you click on the MoodleDocs links I provided for both these terms. In a Lesson you should review the Access control Lesson settings . You could add code that the student would have to type in order to enter the Lesson for the first time. You can also set a time frame by date but not by duration in a Lesson. You can only set the duration a student stays in the course via the course Enrolment settings . Hope this helps, Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Max score should be 100%, but some students stuck at 44.44%
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Why should some students getting all the correct answers in a Lesson be stuck on a 44.44% total score. I have created two simple Lesson activities in my Moodle system (version 1.6.2+). They are 'simple' because there are no branches; both Lessons contain 8 questions, and when student get questions right they are taken to the next question in order, and if wrong, back to the question they got wrong. Students can do the Lessons as many times as they want. Now that some 80 students have done both these lessons, I notice that there is a problem with the scoring for Lesson 2: many students get 100%, however some students appear to have all the answers correct but are only getting 44.44%. All the questions are equally weighted (i.e. custom scoring has not been used). Lesson 1 contains only 'Multiple Choice - Multianswer' type questions, whereas the Lesson with the total score problem contains one 'Multiple Choice' and one Matching type question, and six 'Multiple Choice - Multianswer' type questions. Another difference difference between the two lessons is that one of the 'Multiple Choice - Multianswer' type questions in Lesson 2 has no incorrect answer. My intention was that students have to recognise that all 7 of the choices are correct, and so select all 7 of the choices in order to move to the next question. Could the lack of a wrong choice in this question be the cause? Or could there be another reason why some students getting all the questions right, are only getting 44.44%? And yes, students that are not getting all the questions right are getting correspondingly varied and expected scores.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Max score should be 100%, but some students stuck at 44.44%
ResponsesInList.Text: Did 44.44% students left the quiz midway and logged out or simply closed their browser?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Max score should be 100%, but some students stuck at 44.44%
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Dr. You asked:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Max score should be 100%, but some students stuck at 44.44%
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Peter, Did you figure this out? Following up on Dr.'s question and point, if your Lesson setting "handling of retakes" is set to mean instead of max, then a student who re entered the lesson could never get 100%, if they missed a question on one of their earlier attempts. Oh yes, I have quickly glanced at the logs and assumed that the student took it once. Then realized that while I had correctly set the max attempts at any question to 1 and allowed retakes, my site default is to use the mean and....I forgot to switch it to max. My spreadsheet says 4/9 or 8/18 = 44.44% which might also have me looking at my lesson settings, perhaps max score combined with the mean might give a student a 44%. Then there is the back arrow on the browser that some of my students love to use. That is why I only give them one attempt on an important set of lesson questions. Our message: 'you don't pass the lesson, that is OK but you take the whole lesson over again, so give each question some careful thought the first time, thank you very much.' As soon as they record their answer and leave that screen, Moodle records it. Don't know if that helps or not. Best

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Max score should be 100%, but some students stuck at 44.44%
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Peter, With custom scoring turned Off, if the user answers incorrectly and re-attempts the same question, then that user does not receive full credit for that question. In the lesson reports, I think it only shows their latest answer (which would be the correct one). One way to investigate this is to look at the logs for a particular student. Look to see if the user saw the same question more than once for a single attempt at the Lesson. Hope this helps, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: errors in moodle 24
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Roland, Before reporting those problems in the Moodle bug tracker I suggest that you clarify your questions as I find them rather confused. Please create one new post per question (as is the general rule in forums). For each of your questions, please provide a clear, detailed scenario so that we can clearly understand your problem. Give concrete examples and if possible screenshots. You wrote "4) some times there is a HTML editor, some times not." Well, there is nothing we can do about it if you do not first of all find out in what circumstances you have a different behaviour. We are very willing to help but we cannot "guess" your situation. You have to explain. For me (and I suppose for most moodle users) the Lesson activity works fine in Moodle 2.4. If it does not work for you, you have to prove your case. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: FYI: Work on Question Engine for future
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Notice that Tim Hunt has added a series of pages Development:Question Engine 2 in MoodleDocs of changes that maybe happening in 2.0 and 2.1 concerning Quiz. This may have some indirect impacts on Lesson. While I am not into the Moodle code, I found it interesting. For the adventuresome, take a look at the OpenMark (Open University) link he put in to show some adaptive feedbacks potentials. This is somewhat different from the adaptive model used by Lesson, which is similar to an adaptive (testing) process . The OpenMark example has different feedbacks based upon the student choice and the number of the attempt. Lesson can give different feedbacks based upon the choice made in a question. Lesson's adaptive nature comes from the jumps, that can send the student to another page after they receive feedback. Hard to say, but it looks like this does not happen in the OpenMark example. In short, I do not think it is going to replace Lesson. Best Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: FYI: Work on Question Engine for future
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for starting this thread Chris. I will just add that I hope that my changes will make it easier for other modules like lesson to use questions from the Moodle question bank (something that has been talked about for a long time). Therefore I key bit to look at is Development:Question_Engine_2:Design#API_for_modules_using_the_question_engine .

ResponsesInList.Title: MySQL - show lessons from a course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I've been attempting to create a mysql query which will show the following information from 2 tables. I'm searching for strings contained within the mdl_lesson_pages 'contents' field and outputting which lessons these strings are located & the page within each lesson where the strings are located. So I want to display when search for particular strings the following info:- The onpage lesson id (when moused over from the main course page). The lessonpage id (when inside a lesson) The lesson title (of the lesson) The previous page id (when inside a lesson) The next page id (when inside a lesson) Tables & Fields The mdl_lesson_pages (id), mdl_course_module (instance), mdl_lesson_pages (lessonid), mdl_lesson_pages (title), mdl_course_module (course), mdl_course_module (prevpageid), mdl_course_module (nextpageid) So far I have I can only get this to display all information except for the ID of the mdl_lesson_pages table. This is due to the fact id are both used in the two tables and I need to output the mdl_lesson_pages id and not the mdl_course_modules id but I can't. So far I have this command : SELECT instance, lessonid, title, course, prevpageid, nextpageid FROM mdl_course_modules JOIN mdl_lesson_pages ON mdl_course_modules.instance = mdl_lesson_pages.lessonid WHERE (`contents` LIKE '%/AsbAware_files/%') ORDER BY course LIMIT 0 , 300 this outputs the following : instance lessonid title course prevpageid nextpageid 1374 1374 1.3 The three main types of asbestos 60 60521 60523 1375 1375 2.1.2.4 The Asbestos legacy IS a Major Problem! 60 60526 60528 1375 1375 2.2    Medical Examinations 60 60527 60529 1375 1375 2.4 What are the risks? 60 60529 60531 1376 1376 3.1 examples of asbestos in buildings 60 60532 60534 1376 1376 3.2 Examples of Asbestos-Containing Materials 60 60533 60535 1377 1377 4.0 What to do if you uncover Asbestos 60 0 60537 1377 1377 4.2 Example Asbestos Management Policy (Cont.) 60 60537 60539 1378 1378 5.4 Preventing or reducing exposure (regulation 11... 60 60543 60545 1378 1378 6.1 Supporting Guidance 60 60546 60548 1378 1378 6.2 Further Examples of Asbestos (Cont.) 60 60547 60549 1378 1378 6.2 Further Examples of Asbestos (Cont.) 60 60548 60550 1378 1378 6.2 Further Examples of Asbestos (Cont.) 60 60549 60551 1378 1378 6.2 Further Examples of Asbestos (Cont.) 60 60550 60552 1378 1378 6.2 Further Examples of Asbestos (Cont.) 60 60551 60553 But as you can see this doesn't output the ID from the mdl_lesson_pages table. I can't quite work out how to output the ID field (from either table as they are ambiguous) I was hoping some kind sole would help me out here, this is driving me barmy! I have hundreds of pages where I need to locate certain strings, to do this manually is a knightmare with the lesson module as the ID's don't corresponde. The lessonid & instance are the matching fields from the two tables. Much appreciated for any assistance!! P.S. Why the lesson module built this way I will never know, doesn't make much sense to me... Steve SELECT instance, lessonid, title, course, prevpageid, nextpageid FROM mdl_course_modules JOIN mdl_lesson_pages ON mdl_course_modules.instance = mdl_lesson_pages.lessonid WHERE (`contents` LIKE '% http://www.sheilds.co.uk/NCC/ %') ORDER BY course LIMIT 0 , 300

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How could  I integrate moodle modules in my website?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Alexandru, What many universities and other organisations do is have two websites : an "ordinary" information website a Moodle website The two are linked together and given the same visual theme so that the users are not always aware that they're moving from one site to another. You could do the same. Cheers, Glenys

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How could  I integrate moodle modules in my website?
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes indeed, it is not so uncommon to have a business website (with all the general informtaion that organisations need to share) and a Moodle site (for training and more interactive uses). It is possible to make Moodle pages (Courses) appear within a 'standard' Moodle site by linking (and using Guest access), as Glenys says.  However, the two functions you refer to initially, Forum and Quiz, would both require users to have a Login to the Moodle site becuase Guests cannot post to Forums, or complete Quizzes. Stu.

ResponsesInList.Title: Max attepmts not working?

When a student misses Q1 they go to B5 for a review then back to Q1. When they get Q1 right, they move to next page . Similar with Q2, which jumps to B6. The B4 is the navigational end of the lesson. It's one jump goes to end of lesson. I logged into the lesson as a student. I missed the q1 4 times and got caught in a loop. When I answered it correct, I broke the loop but did not receive credit for getting it right (which I think is logical and the result I want). And just when I thought I knew something about Lesson, I know nothing! Chris

Had you not said that you did the experiment logged in as a student, I would have asked you about that, since the final paragraph of the Help file says this is the one case in which the number of attempts is not recorded.

ResponsesInList.Text: There was a bug with numerical question type in mod/lesson/report.php.  I have fixed the bug and the fix is in the latest build of 1.5.X.  Try downloading the latest lesson module and put its report.php in your lesson module. Let me know if this does not do the trick, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Unable to restore essay responses and feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: I am new to administering Moodle 1.9.7, so please correct me if I am in the wrong place for this question. We restored a course to a new instance of Moodle 1.9.7. The course consists of a lesson with an essay question. In the original location (also 1.9.7), users have responded to this question and the instructor has provided them with feedback and a score. The backup should contain this data. After restoring the course to the new server , the scores are listed but not the users' resopnses or the instructor's feedback. I have tried the following: Restoring the original backup to a different course ID Backing up just the lesson on the original server and restoring it to the course on the new instance Backing up the question on the new instance and restoring it to the same course None of these seem to bring over the responses and feedback. Whats also strange is that the original backups seem to contain the feedback - it is just not getting restored properly. I can see the feedback in the "moodle. xml " file. My guess is that there is a problem with one of the submissions that is interfering with the restore process. There are some %'s in the responses, but I would think Moodle could figure that out. Does anyone have anything to share about this problem? Thank you

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to restore essay responses and feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Anthony, Did you backup and restore that course with the course users ?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to restore essay responses and feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: The backup should have been as complete as I could make it.  So all items checked (with user data), with all role assignments checked, and the following settings: Users Course Logs Yes User Files Yes Course files Yes Site files used in this course Yes Grade histories Yes

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to restore essay responses and feedback
ResponsesInList.Text:
I have an update to this that might be useful. I checked into the database and verified that the data was carried over, but it was not getting displayed in Moodle for some reason. This may only apply to essay questions, but I think I found 2 things that could have been causing this. Specifically, I was looking at the "useranswer" field in the "lesson_attempts" table. I understand this field is created by nesting a call to PHP's "serialize" function inside the "addslashes" function. For essay questions, the object that gets serialized includes both the student's reponse and the instructors feedback. First, I noticed that the serialized form looks something like this: s:X:"RESPONSE HERE" Where (I'm guessing that) "s:" indicates a string data type, "X:" is the length of the string, and RESPONSE HERE is whatever the user typed. I could not determine if X is based on bytes or characters, but I verified that for a simple string like "test", X needs to be exactly 4. More or less and none of the text gets rendered into Moodle. Later, I noticed that some of the text brought over from the old system had EOL's encoded as "
" and others as "
". I also noticed that those encoded as "
" were the ones not getting displayed properly. To fix this, I did a search and replace in these rows for "
", replacing with "
". Now everything is fine. What I am not sure about is why this happened. Both the old and new servers are running in Linux, so I don't think this has to do with Windows newlines. I suspect it is related to the way PHP is serializing this data and then adding slashes. Could it be that this is messing up the "X" number in the serialized form? Does anyone have any insight to this - or how to prevent it from happening? Apparently, the versions of our two Moodle instances are different. This backup came from Moodle 1.9.5 and was restored to 1.9.7. I don't know if that makes a difference. Anyway, my problem is solved, but I would be curious if anyone knows why this happened in case it comes up again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to restore essay responses and feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Well-spotted, Anthony and thanks for the update on this problem. The place where your findings might fit is the Moodle bug tracker. Unfortunately it seems that no-one is taking care of the bugs reported for the Lesson module at the moment - there are more than one hundred reported open issues there. ATB Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to restore essay responses and feedback
ResponsesInList.Text: Logged in the bug tracker as http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-21935 .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Inserting an end of branch.

This message is shown when you try to add an End of Branch when there is no preceding Branch table in the lesson. That string has just been added to CVS . ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completed lesson not assigning a grade??
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm having similar problems. I've got a number of Lessons in one Moodle course and for the first Lesson, the reporting seems to be working fine. The correct information appears in the Activity Completion reports as well as the Lesson > Overview / Statistics reports. However, for another similar Lesson, even when the users have attempted the Lesson, it shows in the Activity Completion report but it does not show in the Lesson > Overview / Statistics reports. It is not set up as a practice lesson and, as far as I can tell, the settings are exactly the same as the first Lesson. We are currently using Moodle 2.7 but upgrading to 2.9.1 next week. Any ideas? Many thanks Catherine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completed lesson not assigning a grade??
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Catherine, IMHO your problem is very different from Jennifer's problem: Jennifer report lesson grades not sent to the gradebook and your problem, if I correctly understand it,  is that some attempts are not shown in Lesson > Overview / Statistics reports. Unfortunately the lesson overview report (and also the lesson detailed report) suffer from some bugs and depending if the lesson is made only of content pages, of a content/question pages mix or only of question pages, the behavior of this report is very different and in some cases nothing is displayed. This is a bug (see MDL-49429 , MDL-48881 , MDL-35396 , MDL-27554 , for various issues affecting lesson reports). Additionally lesson reports are completely unaware of the activity completion system, IMHO this is not a bug, quiz reports also don't show the completion status of students attempts. But if you can give precise examples where you think the completion status is incorrectly reported (reported not completed and in fact it should show completed for instance) please post additional details so that I can investigate the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completed lesson not assigning a grade??

I realise my problem wasn't exactly the same as Jennifer's but I didn't want to create a new Forum post if my problem was related or similar - as far as I can tell, this is frowned upon in the Moodle community. I agree, it's not a bug if the Activity Completion reports are not aware of the Lesson specific overview. ResponsesInList.Title: Code in Essays and short answers
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using the latest version of Moodle 1.7. and I am preparing a series of programming courses for this year. I have a very annoying problem with getting answers from students in either essays or short answer fields. Some of the questions, either essays or short answers require students to type code. Let's take C++ as an example. It uses << insertion, and >> extraction operators. I could ask a question to a student tha requires him/her to type something like: cout << "Hello, World"; The problem is that somehow the HTML editor fiters the user input and recognizes the << as an unfinished tag. As a result, the student answer would be truncated as: cout Is there any setting I can use to turn off HTML filtering from the student's answers so that anything they type is not changed?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Code in Essays and short answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Funny thing is, that this only happens in the lesson module. Any other HTML enabled form will pring the above code just fine. But for some reason it won't on the lesson module, either in the forums or any other text block.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Code in Essays and short answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Since there are no answers, should I assume that Moodle lessons cannot be used to teach programming languages or any lesson that requires the user to type the "<" (less than character) in an essay or a text field?  This works anywhere else, but in the lessons.  Anyone?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Code in Essays and short answers
ResponsesInList.Text: You didn't say what version of Moodle you're using. Did you search the bug tracker ? There was a bug with '<' in Lesson short answer questions ( MDL-2006 ) that was fixed in version 1.7.1, but it may not have fixed YOUR bug. Your bug may have escaped notice because not too many people use essay questions in lessons.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Code in Essays and short answers
ResponsesInList.Text: I am using 1.17.1 stable on LAMP architecture. I found a this thread that might explain the problem. Someone explicitly made sure that you could not write essays with anything that looks like HTML, i.e. cout << "Hello, World";, as it attempts to clean it. I looked into the code of mod/lesson/actions/continue.php and found that it uses a the deprecated PARAM_CLEAN, so I changed it to PARAM_RAW. That solves the problem, but only half way. The students are now able to write the insertion operator (i.e., << ) in the answers and see it display in the response window, but they are not saved in the database because when the teacher tries to grade the essays all of the students answers have dissappeared. I wish I had a UML diagram or something where I could see the Moodle code and what it is doing instead of having to guess and hack my own code. In short, this is a BUG because it doesn't do what is expected of the text field in the lesson module. All other modules (e.g., forum, chat, etc) allow you to type code, but the essay and short answer fields in the lesson module don't.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Code in Essays and short answers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi George, This problem has been fixed for short answer questions, but it looks like the same problem plagues the essay question type. I have entered this into the tracker ( MDL-8375 ) and you can watch it for updates. You must be careful with the modifying the cleaning parameters of form values. The way you currently have your code (half fixed) one could easy perform XSS. Cheers, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: seeing actual answer in short answer question
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello - I am using short answer questions in a lesson in which the learner is recording observations and/or measurements from a hands on activity using one of our trainers (training aid). The example is: What is the measured diamater of the brake drum? The answer would be 8.375 inches. I use an * in the answer box so it will accept any answer. There really is not right or wrong answer. Is there a way that I as the teacher or administrator can see what the actual answer was? Thank you for your help. Gene Brown

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: seeing actual answer in short answer question
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Gene, I don't think so. Lesson saves the aggregate score of questions, not the actual answers nor the scores of individual questions. You can do this in Quiz or as an Assignment in several ways. I am guessing that with some clever settings in a Wiki (page edit) or maybe a Forum (thread response) you might be able to get students to give answers that others don't see but teachers do. Hope this helps. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Using the same lesson again - next year perhaps?
ResponsesInList.Text: Can anyone help me - is it possible to reuse a lesson at a later time? I have only just started playing with the lesson module and I'm quite excited about how well it seems to work. Before I invest hrs setting up a huge lesson is it possible to reuse lessons? I have only set the course for 10 weeks what happens after then? Please help, Jason

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using the same lesson again - next year perhaps?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Jason, yes, just backup your course without user data, and restore it to a new course. Now you have a duplicate of your original course with all the lessons, etc. but without any user data (grades, attempts, etc). Enroll new students and repeat the cycle as often as you like.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using the same lesson again - next year perhaps?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, this is good, but is it possible to actually re-use lessons as well as courses. eg; teaching a subject, realise a student is missing requisite knowledge... want to pull a lesson from a previous course, and make it available in another course... this sort of flexibility would be ideal! - does it exist? Lael

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using the same lesson again - next year perhaps?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Lael, yes, in 1.5 there is a copy activities function. You can copy lessons in from any course you teach into any other course you teach. Actually you can do this in 1.4 also, just choose 'add to exiting course' rather than create new course when doing your backup/restore.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using the same lesson again - next year perhaps?
ResponsesInList.Text: Michael, Thanks! i appreciate the quick response! For clarification - when doing a backup/restore... do you mean of the course? or can you do backups of individual lessons and other objects as well? - then when restoring.. restore to different course?

Publishing as HTML5 creates a folder of files, setting the main file to the index makes the presentation display fine on a file resource activity in Moodle. However, I'd like to have students view it in a Lesson so that we can time their involvement for completion. I tried using the file activity URL however, I get the entire website page. Would it work to find the index page in the repository and link to that URL? Other ideas? I've seen mention of adding a block to the page, but I am unclear which block. There are services available to host the files elsewhere, which generates an embed code --- but I thought there might be a way to do it within Moodle itself. Right now Scorm is not an option for us as it produces error messages for some users that the internet connection is lost. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using iframes in a Lesson
ResponsesInList.Text: You could create a file resource, upload the zipped package, unzip and then set the index.html file as the main file by clicking on it. Make the file resource in Moodle Hidden but available and create your own iframe just linking to that file. You can also accomplish this using Legacy course files (they have to be enabled at admin and then course level). Then you can just link directly to the file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using iframes in a Lesson
ResponsesInList.Text: I know very little about External Tools and IMS content packages (mostly that they exist)...but could either of these help?

ResponsesInList.Title: Lesson development update
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Lesson Users, I wanted to give everyone an update in regards to current Lesson development.  The release of Lesson in Moodle 1.7 will not contain a lot of new features, but rather it will strengthen the code base to improve current features and future maintenance.  You can review the main changes in the Release Notes . The reason for limiting the new features is because the code needed a chance to mature.  Also, there is a planned overhaul detailed here: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Adding_question_types_to_lesson .  This overhaul will essentially require the module to be rewritten from the ground up.  So, to make this process easier, I'm limiting the number of new features and I'm improving the code base to make it easier to upgrade. These recent changes are rather large so please test the Lesson code in 1.7 so we can have a smooth release.  Moodle 1.7 has a planned release date of October 9th and I'm planning to spend time on my weekends to help stabilize the code. If you find bugs, please post them in the bug tracker.  I created a filter to view all open Lesson bugs to make it easier to help.  You can view the filter here: http://tracker.moodle.org/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=hide&requestId=10076 Cheers and happy Moodling, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Lesson development update
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mark, Without your efforts, we would not be maturing.   ) Also a thanks to new users, without your fresh outlook, our community would not understand all the potentials of Moodle or the Lesson module, nor the areas that need to be filled.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How I can add a question in my Moodle bank to a lesson?
ResponsesInList.Text: In Moodle, you can only use the questions from the Question bank in the Quiz module, not in the Lesson module, at least not directly. If you have a "set" (category) of questions in your Question bank that you wish to use in a Lesson, you must first Export that Category (preferably in Moodle XML format), save the export file, then create a new lesson and click the Import questions link. Please note that you can only Import questions into a Lesson just after creating it. Once your lesson contains one or more questions you can no longer IMport new questions. JOseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to remove "Pop-up to file or web page"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for reporting this bug. I will do some testing and try to find a patch before reporting to the bug tracker. I'll report here. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to remove "Pop-up to file or web page"
ResponsesInList.Text: I have found a fix for this problem, but in the course of searching for the fix I found another bug, plus a mis-nomer. 1.- If you edit one lesson's settings several times and change the media file to be displayed in the popup window, upon re-opening the Edit Lesson page, the file's reference will sometimes revert to the previous, instead of the current one. The bug occurs if you select the new file for the popup from the "Recent Files" repository. It does not occur if you select it from " Upload a file". EDIT .- this bug is not related to the Lesson Module itself, but to the new moodle 2.0 file management system. I will report to the tracker. 2.- Mis-nomer: "Pop-up to file or web page" should really be "Pop-up to file", as one can only link to a file in that context . Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to remove "Pop-up to file or web page"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for looking into it. Please let us know the tracker MDL-id so we can know when a fix is available.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to remove "Pop-up to file or web page"
ResponsesInList.Text: See MDL-25552 . You might like to apply the patch to your own moodle site if you are in a hurry, rather than wait for the bug to be fixed in the moodle distribution. Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to remove "Pop-up to file or web page"

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Unable to remove "Pop-up to file or web page"
ResponsesInList.Text: Your IT support should know how to apply a patch. If you are on your own, and have never applied patches yourself, you can follow a fairly simple approach. Before you do anything please backup your moodle site or at least the files that you are going to patch! If you open the patch I have provided in bug tracker MDL-25552 (in any text editor) you see that there are 2 files to patch: moodle/mod/lesson/mod_form.php and moodle/mod/lesson/lib.php. Open each of these files (on your server ) and remove the lines marked - and add the files marked +. That's all! However, it would be better to ask help from an IT person familiar with the concept of file patching. Joseph PS. One way to "promote" bug fixes is to vote for them in the bug tracker. So far only one person has voted!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: upload power point into lession
ResponsesInList.Text: There is a video about import PowerPoint to moodle. At the same time, you can do as following steps: 1. Save your PowerPoint presentation As a Web Page. 2. The result should be a htm file and a folder with all of the slides converted to web pages. ZIP THE FOLDER only. 3. Go to your moodle site and add a new lesson. 4. After saving the lesson settings you should see four options under "What would you like to do first?" Click on "Import PowerPoint" 5. Use to the "Browse..." button to find your zip file from step 2. Then click on "Upload this file". 6. If everything worked, the next screen should just display a continue button. Notes: 1.Complicated presentations with animations, transitions and graphic effects can not be imported correctly. Text presentations with simple graphic images works best. Alternatively, converting your PowerPoint presentation to Flash with SCORM /AICC compliance and then upload the lesson to Moodle would be a good way. It can keep the animations, transitions of the PowerPoint. There are some PowerPoint to Flash converters could help you, such as Adobe Presenter, Articulate Presenter and Wondershare PPT2Flash Professional . Hope it helps!

Why has this assumption been removed? It was perfectly reasonable. Now I have to go through every page in every lesson and change them to "Next Page" and label the button "Continue"? And in the process change the formatting of every page from what I want to some random formatting (See the second forum link above)? Oi! 1.- If your lesson does not end in a Question Page, what kind of page does it end with, then? I suppose it ends in a Content page. What did you put in the Jump field of that last page? If it's the last page of your lesson, you should put Jump:  " End of Lesson ". Can you please check and report? 2.- The "More information about this error" links in Moodle are a pretty new feature, and a large number of links have not been written in the Documentation Wiki yet. 3.- I agree that the migration process should automatically fill in the Description field with "Continue" and its Jump field with "Next page". That has been overlooked in the migration scripts somewhere. After further testing and confirmation by other people in this forum, I will post to the bug tracker the necessary information. Joseph

That is to say, if it were a Question Page, I made sure that wrong answers went to "This Page" and right answers went to "Next Page," but if "Next Page" was the only option (in content pages / branch tables OR question pages), then I just left it blank. A linear path through a lesson, I would think, would be the rule rather than the exception. Furthermore, the error that's arisen here is fixed by either changing the jump field to "Next Page" OR "End of Lesson." That tells me that Moodle STILL looks for a "next page" and if it doesn't find one, takes you to "End of Lesson." In other words, if the 'next page as default' assumption --which, again, we've agreed is a good thing -- is returned, then this end of lesson problem will be fixed as well. ResponsesInList.Title: Title of Question Page showing up in left hand lesson menu block
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there. I'm pretty new to lessons but feel like I'm getting the hang of it. I'm using version 1.9.2. Some of the things that I've tried to do have been answered in this forum - thanks. When I set up a lesson with branch tables and question pages, I can choose to display the title of the branch table in the left hand lesson menu block (or not). When I set up a question page and I add the the page title my expectation is that it will automatically appear in the left hand lesson menu block but it doesn't. This makes it difficult for students to know that there is a quiz in the lesson. Have I missed something? Does anyone know how I can have a question page title appear in the left hand lesson menu block? Cheers - Dane

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Title of Question Page showing up in left hand lesson menu block
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dane, We insert a branch table before the question or quiz and title it "Exercise 2" (or whatever). Text of the page is "click continue to go to Exercise 2." Be aware that lesson is a touchy beast with questions. If a student leaves the lesson before it is completed, when student returns, Moodle asks if student wants to continue where left off or not. If student chooses not, the lesson restarts, which wipes out previous answers to questions. We here are working to remove questions from lessons and put them into quiz modules. The reporting on questions is more detailed in quiz than in lesson, as well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Title of Question Page showing up in left hand lesson menu block
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Ben Thanks a lot for your reply. You have confirmed my fears of using questions in a lesson. My task today was to look at exactly what you have mentioned i.e. what happens when a student leaves a lesson before the end, then when returning, choosing to start from the beginning therefore wiping out their answers (as you have highlighted). Thanks for that too!

ResponsesInList.Title: What is a Lesson, what is a Quiz and why can't I do it all?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dane, Excellent post. I think one of the issues with Lesson is the purpose of a Lesson or that it's mission needs to be tightened. My sense is that due to popular demand, many things were added to Lesson at a time when Moodle was not as robust. I also believe that Lesson is used in many sites for different purposes, which at times means cross purposes. To sort the cross purposes (for example, I want to see Question titles on left along with Branch table titles, or I want to see some but not all page titles on the left), means changing settings and adding more variables to the module, or dividing the module up into similiar but different ones. Lesson can present pages in a adaptive manner. I suspect this is why the first standard module to have a conditional dependency built in was Lesson. In Version 2, when conditional dependency starts to become a Moodle feature in many/all standard modules, we may start to see a change in Lesson. Lessons may become shorter and perhaps more numerous with Moodle conditional dependency. First conditional dependency of modules and resources within a course, will probably build demand for site dependencies of the nested if, then type conditions. Now we are really talking about adaptive (and complex) learning. I think one of the next logical development steps in Lesson is to be able to export and import any Lesson page(s). First to be able to import specific pages into another lesson, then to be able to import specific pages into other modules and import pages from other modules into Lesson. Just one example concerns Lesson being able to have access to the Question Bank. Exciting stuff, in short Lesson has a lot of different possible looks. Perhaps Lesson needs to be broken up into more specific modules. Right now, there is nothing else like a Lesson :} Best Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: What is a Lesson, what is a Quiz and why can't I do it all?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chris Thanks for your reply (sorry if you got a blank email from me - clicked the wrong button!) I think I was expecting a lesson to fulfill all my course needs but obviously it doesn't (yet). So, I have decided not to use the lesson format at all now and will use a combination of web pages and quizzes. I'm also looking into Hot Potato quizzes which look very interesting and can easily (it seems) be used in Moodle. I'm also developing self contained mini websites that can be part of a web page with (hopefully) a Hot pot(s) below it. See how this goes. Anyway, thanks again - very interesting. Cheers - Dane

ResponsesInList.Title: New to lessons - branch or cluster?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I have looked at the great demo lessons but just need a last bit of guidance. My proposed lesson needs no grades it is about people from different areas, each learning several concepts say areas are A1, A2 and A3 concepts are C1 to C5 students interested in A1 need to see C1, C3 and C4 those in A2 need C3, C4 and C5 for example After the intro, I understand a branch page will take me to A1, A2 or A3. A1, A2 and A3 would be branch pages liking to C1 ... as appropriate. The question is, when people have looked at their first relevant concept, how do they get back to their correct page A1, 2 or 3? They should not be concerned with concepts their areas do not cover. I'm sure there is a simple answer! The only one that comes to me is to have the concepts in a glossary, so to read them the student hops from the area page via a link and uses the back button to return to the course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New to lessons - branch or cluster?
ResponsesInList.Text: After any lesson page type, be it Branch Table or Question Page, you are in charge, via the Jump dropdowns which list pages in the Lesson, of where the flow goes next.  So after C1, you set the flow to return to A1. The only problem would come if a C1 page was shared between A1 students and A2 students.  I think in that case you'd have to create 2 identical pages with different Jump (next page) settings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New to lessons - branch or cluster?
ResponsesInList.Text: I like Dave's explanation and suggestion. I use duplicate pages when I really do not want to give the student a choice where to go. Even if the duplicate pages have exactly the same content, I give them similar but different page titles. Alternatively, you can always put multiple jumps at the end of the end of a concept in a branch table with different lables. Such as "Go to A1", "Go to A2", "Go to Concept 3", "End the Lesson", "Go to TOC (1st page)" or what ever. Here you let your students use their intelligence to get to where they want. As stated elsewhere it is always a good idea to give the student a way to start all over again without exiting the lesson. My tip would be one I recently relearned from an old pro: draw it out on paper with boxes and lines. You do not need to create a box for each page, but (in your example) create one for each area and one for each concept. Draw lines to connect them and one way arrows to indicate jumps. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New to lessons - branch or cluster?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you to both Dave and Chris. Certainly the duplicate page is the simplest solution, even if not the most advanced puzzle-solving for he person doing the lesson. I've done the diagram work (as you say, invaluable) and were it a set of html pages the plan would be simple because as you guessed C1 is C1 and so on.. The actual context is the lesson supports grant funding for different areas in the country. The grant rules (concepts) are consistent but some areas have grants that others do not, so it is unfair to explain to people the grants they could never apply for. Thanks - will get it cracked today! Ed

ResponsesInList.Title: Questions about using the Lesson Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I am working with a tutor to set up a quiz using the lesson module - students must get each question right before they can continue to the next, so lesson seemed more suitable than quiz. I would like to know if I have missed something with the following, which have been fed back to me from the tutor: It is difficult for students to see their results at the end of the lesson before the page redirects. When they go to the gradebook to review their score they cannot review attempts. Clicking the score takes you to a new attempt not the overview of the previous attempt. When custom scoring is set to yes I can set individual question scores but not a maximum score so I end up with a score of 11 out of 0, which returns 0% instead of 100%. Reverting to non-custom scoring I get 9 out of 9, which returns the correct percentage. I have set each question to return to the same question page if the student guesses the wrong answer, so that they must try again until they get it right. However, scoring only records the first guess so that if you got a question right on the 2nd attempt it would receive a 0 score, instead of 1 for correct, which we would prefer. Yours James

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questions about using the Lesson Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi James, Been down this road. You raised 3 points. I feel more comfortable with the last two. I think Lesson settings have most of the answers. You didn't say which version of Moodle so I will stick with 1.5.4 but this will generally be correct for 1.6 and 1.7. 1. See their results, see number of attempts. How about showing the students their running score. Others may want to make suggestions here, we don't use grades, just pass or fail. 2. Custom scoring . Go to Lesson settings and change the Max Grade from 0 (current setting from your description) to what ever you want. Alternative. Turn off custom scoring.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questions about using the Lesson Module
ResponsesInList.Text: 2. Custom scoring . Go to Lesson settings and change the Max Grade from 0 (current setting from your description) to what ever you want. Alternative. Turn off custom scoring. I think with custom scoring turned Off , the problem would persist. The Lesson grading scales the final grade down to X out of Maximum Grade. So, if Maximum Grade is zero, then you will always receive zero for your final grade. Cheers, Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questions about using the Lesson Module
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply - I am running Moodle 1.6.1 2. I have maximum grade set to 100, which works fine for non-custom scoring but not for custom scoring. We have it working as intended on non-custom scoring. 3. Thanks, I had max attempts set at 1. However I actually noticed that each attempt counts seperately so I have 9 questions and got 9/12 because I'd had multiple attempts on the some questions. Thanks James

ResponsesInList.Title: Easily add FLV Player to Moodle
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hey everyone, I have burned some brain cells on this off and on for the last few days. Although Moodle has a built in player, I wanted my traditional player, the FLV Player . Due to the Tiny editor, my code would always get messed up, and in a week I will not be the guy who would be doing these lessons. So I had to be able to give this program over to a person that has minimal experience with Moodles use. It has to be close to cut and paste. I am far from a Moodle expert! It suddenly hit me, if the editor is messing up the FLV's call to the swfobject.js file, then put that line of code outside the editor. So I dumped it into the header.php file in my theme directory. In the root directory (with the moodle directory list) I created a js directory. In there I put swfobject.js and player.swf. More for neatness then necessity. As an example... 
```text
edit header.php and put this script line in above the closing </head>
...
<script type="text/
javascript
" src="js/swfobject.js"></script>
...

Then anywhere in the page I wanted the mp3 player, I opened the HTML view and pasted my actual code.

<embed
width="300"
height="20"
src="js/player.swf"
allowscriptaccess="always"
allowfullscreen="true"
flashvars="file=/audio/yourMP3file.mp3&autostart=true"
/>
```
 This will work for flash movies or mp3. For movies you will have to change the height to at least 300 =-). I tried a number of the other players and I just really like the FLV Player and it's community. My company has a licence with the FLV developers but they do have a watermarked free version. There are some issues, if you run multiple players on a single page you will have to head over to the documentation and again the editor may cause some heartache. When you load the page with all the lessons on it, and you have the player set to autoplay, the page will take a while to load. To remove the auto play feature remove "&autostart=true".

ResponsesInList.Title: Ordering of Grade Essays list - could it be alphabetical by student
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi We're using Lessons for some medical scenarios which students work through. The Lesson tool is working very well for this and we are getting very positive student feedback (so, thanks!) The student responses are mostly Essays, which are graded by volunteer tutors. We have 30 tutors, each with approx 12 students' work to mark. The Grade Essay page shows the student submissions in date order, earliest to latest. This is causing problems for our tutors as they are having to pick out their students from a very long list. Is it possible to change the sorting order to be alphabetical by student surname, so that the tutors could more quickly find their students from within the list? Also just wondered if there is a reason for not being able to use groups - it would be handy in this case but the above would be nearly as good. Many thanks for any help you can give,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ordering of Grade Essays list - could it be alphabetical by student
ResponsesInList.Text: To sort the results I resorted to hacking the code in essay.php. The page works by building an array of links - so it seemed easiest to just sort that before displaying it to the page. The hack is shown below - it looks at the link and extracts the last word in it which it assumes to be the surname - then sorts by that. As I said - it's a last minute hack. I'm still kind of new to Moodle - so there may be a nicer Moodle way to do it with existing library functions - in which case I welcome your input - but as a quick and dirty fix this certainly works. It goes around line 300 or so just before print_table. /* * hack - two functions to process the $data array in the $table to allow sorting by lastname */ function ucl_stripname($n) { // this extracts the lastname from the link string $la=explode('',$n); $fullname=trim($la[1]); $fa=explode(' ',$fullname); $nc = count($fa); if ($fa[$nc-1]<>'') { $lastname=$fa[$nc-1]; } else { $lastname=$fullname; //just in case there's no space in their name } return $lastname; } function ucl_compare_lastname($a, $b) { // custom sort return strnatcmp(ucl_stripname($a[0]), ucl_stripname($b[0])); } # sort alphabetically by lastname usort($table->data, 'ucl_compare_lastname'); /* * end of hack! */ Hope this is of use. Feedback welcome. Pete

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ordering of Grade Essays list - could it be alphabetical by student
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Pete, To achieve the same result in moodle 2.2, I've modified mod/lesson/essay.php around line 331 and  just replaced foreach (array_keys($studentessays) as $userid) { with foreach (array_keys($users) as $userid) { $users is an array of all the users who have taken this lesson, order by their last name.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Content page display for set time before moving to questions

ResponsesInList.Title: Essay based Lessons, help needed

In short I have a multi part assignment, 6 essay sections with 4 essay subsections each, e.g. B1a B2a C1a C2a; B1b B2b C1b C2b; etc I wanted to set up a Lesson with conditional activities that means that they have to hand in and receive a specific grade for 1 section before they can progress to the next subsection. Is this possible? Do I need a plug in, and if so which would you recommend? All help gratefully received!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essay based Lessons, help needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, You don't need a plugin. In the course settings there is one checkbox which says track completion It should be enabled. By enabling this you will be able to create dependency from chapter to other chapter like if student has scored 70% in the previous quiz then only he can go forward...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essay based Lessons, help needed
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Stef, I am familiar only with MOODLE 1.9. So, the contribution of Viral its an option for sure. Two options: Well, in case of the MOODLE 1.9, in the lesson there is a dependency option where you can define what you want. You can use it if you set all the 4 essay subsections as 4 different lessons, each dependent on the former grade lesson. The other option is to set the menu to show only if the grade is better than a value (you can do this in the lesson configuration), and the essay will appear only in the menu (see note 1). Of course you have to choose the path of your lesson in order that the student doesn't found the essay with the buttons. I suggest that you use a map to design your lesson: cmap tools can help. I hope this is helpfull. Good work. António note 1: you must notice that the essay questions doesn't appear in the menu, but if you put a branch table called "essay question" and choose the button to go to that question...

ResponsesInList.Title: Lesson copy/paste within a course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Guys, anybody know if there is a way copy/past , or backup/restore, or export/import a Lesson topic to another lesson topic within a course? Esentially, I have a Course which will have several lesson, with each has similar structure(#of pages, #of quizzes, #of branch tables, etc), I like to eliminate the time cost to create a lesson structure every single time. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Lesson copy/paste within a course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, "Lesson topic" confused me in your post, so I have two answers. I don't know of a way to import a lesson segment into another lesson. Duplicating a Lesson in a course can be done. The standard trick I use is to do a backup of just the lesson, then restore it and move it to where I want in my course. There is also the import function in the course admin block which does something similar (I am old Moodle so I don't use this feature that cuts out a few steps). You probably don't want student info nor course files, but that is a decision you will make. If I knew I would be using several copies of a lesson format, I would create a template from an existing lesson, so I didn't have to delete lots of lesson specific content. I would check out placing these in a hidden course, or saving the backups on my local computer. Hope this helps. Chris

ResponsesInList.Title: Is there an easy way to merge two lessons?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I was wandering if there is a simple way to compile few lessons into a single one?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is there an easy way to merge two lessons?
ResponsesInList.Text: Robert,  I don't think so.   If there is I would like to know it.   There is no export or inport function that I know about in 1.6 or earlier when it comes to a lesson. The closest is importing questions.  The importPPT function probably can be hacked so it is an option seen all the time, instead of just at the start.  But export entire or sections of a lesson, then import or merging lessons, with our without student data, no. I had 200 page lesson that we decided to break up into 8 smaller units.   It was almost like I had to restore the same 200 page lesson 8 times, then delete the pages I didn't want.   It was ugly, even with some creative short cuts. A wild idea.  You could establish links between the two lessons, but links are not controlled navigation and thus is not a merge.

ResponsesInList.Title: Lesson activity questions so limited for teaching languages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Recently I have started to make lessons for teaching English language. Using lesson activity, I have come to notice that I can only add a single question in a separate page after I have presented some material first as content pages. This is a huge limitation in itself for teaching English language. I mean, teaching languages often requires introducing new subjects (vocabulary, grammar, pronunciation ,etc)  by constantly engaging learners with short questions (especially in form of cloze tests) which can appear everywhere during a lesson and not necessarily at the end. You simply do not feed your students with some content first and test their understanding of it later at the end with a reading passage and questions of some type related to it. Of course, that's not the only problem. When, for instance, we speak of the short answer question type which is somehow similar to a cloze test - a format available in quizzes but not so in lesson activity - we have to provide a question of a certain length first with one "short answer" for the whole question. This can probably be good for such fields of study as Mathematics, Physics, and so on, but not for teaching languages, where you might provide a passage with several blanks which have to be filled up by students. And sometimes, you provide several of such questions in the same page which is again not possible to do so in a lesson activity question page (i.e. you can have one question per page). I really would like to use Moodle for language teaching especially due to its various other powerful user-friendly capabilities, but I am somehow at my wit's end in coping with the above-mentioned problem. Please do let me know if I have overlooked a feature already available in Moodle which does the same thing in a lesson activity or if you have overcome this shortcoming one way or another. I would really appreciate it. Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Lesson activity questions so limited for teaching languages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Saeed, For the scenario you are describing, you could actually use a quiz to overcome the lesson shortcomings, if you set it up right. Set the quiz up so that it does NOT shuffle the question order. It IS okay for multiple choice questions to shuffle their answers, though. Place all of your newly introduced information in Descriptions. They are listed under OTHER when choosing a question type to add/create. Follow each of the "Description" questions with as many regular quiz questions as you need, on a page of the quiz. Start another page in your quiz with another "Description." Follow with more questions. Manually insert descriptions and questions in the order you need, with page breaks when needed. Repeat until you have covered the "Lesson." Like the Lesson module, doing it this way, everything except essay type questions will be automatically graded when the student submits for grading at the end of the quiz. Doing it this way has the advantage of letting you use ALL of the types of questions available for the quiz module, including addon questions types, such as the PoodLL one that is capable of audio or video or whiteboard, plus others such as gap- fill, drag and drop, etc. They are great  for teaching correct grammar and punctuation. To me, the only downside I see when doing a "Lesson" this way, is you will have to put up with question numbers, which you would not normally see when using the Lesson activity, but students soon get used to them and ignore them. Another point that may or may not apply to your situation, is that you can also set the quiz navigation up so that they cannot skip ahead or go back, if you so desire. Using the quiz this way, you can actually set up a small question bank of various questions to go along with ONE "Description", then create a a quiz that has the "Description" first, then is followed by a few randomly selected questions to reinforce the material presented in the "Description." Each student gets a different experience each time they do the quiz. HTH , AL

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Lesson activity questions so limited for teaching languages
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi AL Thanks a lot for your detailed informative response. It seems I do not have any luck with lessons activity then, so I have to opt for the quiz solution and design my lessons the way you have kindly explained. The limitation is saddening, though, to me. I wonder if there is a chance we can witness more flexibility in respect with lesson question types in future Moodle versions. Do you know where we can request this? Regards Saeed

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Lesson activity questions so limited for teaching languages
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Saeed, in addition to what Al indicates, you can play with another awesome quiz-feature: the question behaviour. So you can, if you want it so, distinguish a "formal" test from a "learning" or "training" test. I also teach foreign languages and tried with the lesson module but I got irritated with the limited question types. Regards, Beatriz.

ResponsesInList.Title: navigation differs by login
ResponsesInList.Text: I noticed that the jump after a page in a lesson is influenced by the kind of login, that means navigation is different for guest-logins and student-logins Using 1.5.3 I have a lesson with one multiple choice question per page, and every wrong answer should jump to the same page, and only the right answer should jump to the next page. When i check the lesson as administrator this works fine. As i login as guest, it also works fine. But when i login with my student-account, every jump is to the next page, no matter if my answer is right or wrong. I could not find this as a known problem. (for what my searching is worth). I do not tend to believe it is a problem with my installation/ server . Is this problem known to be fixed in 1.6, or are there other workarounds known ? Rob (rgra)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: navigation differs by login
ResponsesInList.Text: In your lesson settings, do you have attempts set to 1? Navigation is indeed different for administrators/teachers and students. The help file for "Maximum number of attempts" may be helpful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: navigation differs by login
ResponsesInList.Text: You are perfectly right, attempts was set to 1 and the help file for "Maximum number of attempts" was useful indeed. Stupid i overlooked this, considered afterwards it's simple logic. Thank you very much for your helpful reply, it solved my problem in a minute. Rob.
